content:
Yes, some of the real-life people who the characters in The Sopranos were based on have come forward with their thoughts on the show. For example, Vincent "Vinny Ocean" Palermo, the New Jersey mob boss who inspired the character of Tony Soprano, gave an interview to the New York Post in 1999 where he discussed his thoughts on the show's portrayal of the Mafia. Palermo commented that the show was "pretty accurate" in its depiction of mob life, but he also pointed out some inaccuracies, such as the idea that mobsters would get into physical altercations with each other the way characters on the show often do.

Other real-life people who were portrayed on the show have also commented on its accuracy. For example, former FBI agent Joe Pistone, who went undercover as a mob associate in the 1970s and whose experiences inspired the movie Donnie Brasco, gave an interview to The Daily Beast in 2014 where he praised the show's portrayal of both the Mafia and law enforcement. Overall, it seems that many of the real-life people who the characters in The Sopranos were based on have recognized the show's accuracy and nuance in depicting their world.
